submodules.title: Task Management UI
submodules.description: A clean and intuitive interface that allows users to add, complete, and delete tasks effortlessly. The UI is designed to be minimalistic, ensuring that users can focus on their tasks without distractions.

submodules.title: Responsive Design
submodules.description: Ensures that the application is fully responsive, providing an optimal viewing experience across a wide range of devices, from desktops to mobile phones. This includes fluid layouts and adaptable elements that adjust to different screen sizes.

submodules.title: Theme Toggle
submodules.description: An optional feature that allows users to switch between light and dark themes, enhancing user experience based on their preferences and environmental lighting conditions.

submodules.title: Task Filtering
submodules.description: An optional feature that enables users to filter tasks by their status: all, active, or completed. This helps users manage their tasks more effectively by allowing them to focus on what needs to be done.

submodules.title: LocalStorage Management
submodules.description: Handles the storage of tasks in the browser's localStorage, ensuring that tasks persist even after the user closes the application. This includes functions for adding, updating, and deleting tasks from localStorage.

submodules.title: Data Structure Design
submodules.description: Defines the structure of task objects, including properties such as task title, completion status, and timestamps. This ensures that all necessary information is stored efficiently and can be easily retrieved.

submodules.title: Checkbox Functionality
submodules.description: Allows users to mark tasks as done using a simple checkbox interface. This feature provides immediate visual feedback, enhancing the sense of accomplishment as users complete their tasks.

submodules.title: Minimal UI Design
submodules.description: Focuses on a clean and uncluttered user interface that prioritizes usability. The design minimizes distractions and emphasizes the core functionality of task management.

submodules.title: Unit Testing
submodules.description: Conducts unit tests on individual components and functions to ensure they work as intended. This includes testing the task addition, deletion, and completion functionalities.

submodules.title: User Acceptance Testing
submodules.description: Involves real users testing the application to gather feedback on usability and functionality. This helps identify any issues or areas for improvement before the final release.

submodules.title: User Guide
submodules.description: Provides comprehensive documentation for users, detailing how to use the application, including features like task management, theme toggling, and filtering.

submodules.title: Developer Documentation
submodules.description: Includes technical documentation for developers, outlining the code structure, API endpoints, and guidelines for future development and maintenance.
